issues.description: Problem statement UML specifies Animal has a constructor Animal(String, int), but both the provided Main usage in the template and the reference implementation define only single‐parameter constructors (e.g. Seal(String), Pig(String), Goat(String)) and Animal(String). This mismatch prevents students from following both the UML and the starter code without adjustments.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the UML and instructions to require only a single String parameter for Animal (and subclasses), or modify all constructors (Animal and its subclasses) to accept both String and int parameters and update Main accordingly.

issues.description: The UML and problem description declare that Animal has two attributes (name: String and age: int) with corresponding getter/setter, but the reference implementation’s Animal class (and the template usage) omits the age field entirely. This inconsistency leaves students unclear whether to include and manage an age attribute.
issues.suggested_fix: Either remove the age attribute from the UML and problem description if it is not needed, or add a private int age field (with getter/setter) to Animal in both the template and reference implementation to match the specification.
